page.title: 06NORTH BEDFORD LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Towards the opposite end of{Bedford {Park,}after passing near tennis courts, bowling green and bandstand, is the{Robinson indoor swimming pool. Just north of this amenity is the main Bedford cemetery. Here can be seen the graves of the{Wyatt family,}who founded the{"BEDFORDSHIRE TIMES"}in 1845 and which is still published today. A few hundred yards walk away can be seen the old-fashioned brick, tower-like building, within which is a 150 feet, deep, clear{spring water {well,}sunk in 1902 for a{local {brewery's}pure water supply. This supply comes from as far away as Northampton and is one of several wells for the brewery in Bedford.
